00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlSlicer - main core of the 3D Slicer
00015 // .SECTION Description
00016 // Handles layers of images for the 3 slices, and everything related to 
00017 // their display.  (i.e. reformatting, orientation, cursor, filtering)
00018 // Handles drawing before the points are applied.
00019 // Does math w.r.t. reformat matrices, etc.
00020 //
00021 // Don't change this file without permission from slicer@ai.mit.edu.  It
00022 // is intended to be general enough so developers don't need to hack it.
00023 //
00024 
00025 #ifndef __vtkMrmlSlicer_h
00026 #define __vtkMrmlSlicer_h

00060 // Orient
00061 
00062 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_AXIAL        0
00063 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_SAGITTAL     1
00064 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_CORONAL      2
00065 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_INPLANE      3
00066 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_INPLANE90    4
00067 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_INPLANENEG90 5
00068 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_NEW_ORIENT         6
00069 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_REFORMAT_AXIAL    7
00070 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_REFORMAT_SAGITTAL 8
00071 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_REFORMAT_CORONAL  9
00072 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_PERP         10
00073 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_ORIGSLICE    11
00074 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_AXISLICE     12
00075 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_SAGSLICE     13
00076 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_CORSLICE    14
00077 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_AXISAGCOR   15
00078 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_ORTHO       16
00079 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_SLICES      17
00080 #define MRML_SLICER_ORIENT_REFORMAT_AXISAGCOR   18
00081 #define MRML_SLICER_NUM_ORIENT         19

00093   //------ Output things to be displayed in slice s: ------//
00094 
00095   // Description:
00096   // Overlay is merged fore, back, and label images, for display
00097   // in slice window s (where s is 0, 1, or 2)
00098 
00099   // >> AT 11/09/01
00100   //vtkImageData *GetOutput(int s) {
00101   //  this->Update(); return this->Overlay[s]->GetOutput();};
00102   vtkImageData *GetOutput(int s) {
00103     this->Update(); return this->Overlay3DView[s]->GetOutput();}
00104   // << AT 11/09/01
00105 
00106   // Description:
00107   // Cursor is the moving cross-hair for over slice s
00108   vtkImageData *GetCursor(int s) {
00109     this->Update(); return this->Cursor[s]->GetOutput();};
00110 
00111   // Description:
00112   // Active output is either the contour just drawn or the regular
00113   // overlay image, depending on the slice it is for.
00114   vtkImageData *GetActiveOutput(int s) {
00115     this->Update();
00116     if (this->ActiveSlice == s) 
00117       return this->PolyDraw->GetOutput();
00118     else 
00119       return this->Overlay[s]->GetOutput();
00120   };
00121

00123   // The active slice is the one last touched by the user.

00301   //-------------------- Filter pipeline  -------------------------//
00302 
00303   // Description:
00304   // Convenient pipeline hook for developers.
00305   // First and last filters of any pipeline (or part of pipeline)
00306   // whose output should be displayed in a slice.
00307   // For example, this is used in Editor/EdThreshold.tcl for
00308   // dynamic thresholding.
00309   // This is for display only!  It can't be used to actually change
00310   // the volumes in the slicer.  Use the editor (vtkImageEditorEffects)
00311   // for that.
00312   void SetFirstFilter(int s, vtkImageToImageFilter *filter);
00313   // LastFilter is of type vtkImageSource, a superclass of 
00314   // both vtkImageToImage and vtkMultipleInput filters.
00315   void SetLastFilter(int s, vtkImageSource *filter);
00316   vtkImageToImageFilter* GetFirstFilter(int s) {return this->FirstFilter[s];};
00317   vtkImageSource* GetLastFilter(int s) {return this->LastFilter[s];};
00318 
00319   // Description:
00320   // Whether to apply pipeline defined by first, last filter
00321   // to the Back slice
00322   vtkGetMacro(BackFilter, int);
00323   vtkSetMacro(BackFilter, int);
00324   vtkBooleanMacro(BackFilter, int);
00325 
00326   // Description:
00327   // Whether to apply pipeline defined by first, last filter
00328   // to the Fore slice
00329   vtkGetMacro(ForeFilter, int);
00330   vtkSetMacro(ForeFilter, int);
00331   vtkBooleanMacro(ForeFilter, int);
00332 
00333   // Description:
00334   // Whether to apply pipeline defined by first, last filter
00335   // only to Active slice or to all three slices
00336   vtkGetMacro(FilterActive, int);
00337   vtkSetMacro(FilterActive, int);
00338   vtkBooleanMacro(FilterActive, int);
00339 
00340   // Description:
00341   // Whether to overlay filter output on all layers 
00342   // or use it to replace the fore layer.

00461   vtkPoints* CopyGetPoints()
00462   {
00463       return this->CopyPoly;
00464   };
00465 
00466   void CopySetDrawPoints()
00467   {
00468       int n = this->DrawGetNumPoints();
00469       if (n < 1) return;
00470       this->CopyPoly->Reset();
00471       vtkPoints *polygon = this->DrawGetPoints();
00472       vtkFloatingPointType *rasPt;
00473       for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00474       {
00475           rasPt = polygon->GetPoint(i);
00476           this->CopyPoly->InsertNextPoint(rasPt[0], rasPt[1], rasPt[2]);
00477       }
00478   };
00479 
00480   // ---- Stack of polygons ---- //
00481   void StackSetPolygon(int window, int s, int d)
00482   {
00483     switch (window)
00484     {
00485       case 0: AxiPolyStack->SetPolygon(this->PolyDraw->GetPoints(), s, d);
00486               break;
00487       case 1: SagPolyStack->SetPolygon(this->PolyDraw->GetPoints(), s, d);
00488               break;
00489       case 2: CorPolyStack->SetPolygon(this->PolyDraw->GetPoints(), s, d);
00490               break;
00491     }
00492   };
00493 
00494   vtkPoints* StackGetPoints(int window, int s)
00495   {
00496     switch (window)
00497     {
00498       case 0: return this->AxiPolyStack->GetPoints(s);
00499               break;
00500       case 1: return this->SagPolyStack->GetPoints(s);
00501               break;
00502       case 2: return this->CorPolyStack->GetPoints(s);
00503               break;
00504     }
00505   };
00506 
00507   vtkPoints* StackGetPoints(int window, int s, int p)
00508   {
00509     switch (window)
00510     {
00511       case 0: return this->AxiPolyStack->GetPoints(s, p);
00512               break;
00513       case 1: return this->SagPolyStack->GetPoints(s, p);
00514               break;
00515       case 2: return this->CorPolyStack->GetPoints(s, p);
00516               break;
00517     }
00518   };
00519 
00520   void StackSetPolygon(int window, int s, int p, int d, int closed, int preshape, int label)
00521   {
00522     switch (window)
00523     {
00524       case 0: AxiPolyStack->SetPolygon(this->PolyDraw->GetPoints(), s, p, d, closed, preshape, label);
00525               break;
00526       case 1: SagPolyStack->SetPolygon(this->PolyDraw->GetPoints(), s, p, d, closed, preshape, label);
00527               break;
00528       case 2: CorPolyStack->SetPolygon(this->PolyDraw->GetPoints(), s, p, d, closed, preshape, label);
00529               break;
00530     }
00531   };
00532 
00533   vtkPoints* RasStackSetPolygon(int window, int s, int p, int d, int closed, int preshape, int label)
00534   {
00535       vtkPoints *polygon = this->PolyDraw->GetPoints();
00536       vtkFloatingPointType *screenPt;
00537       int as = this->GetActiveSlice();
00538       int n = polygon->GetNumberOfPoints();
00539       vtkFloatingPointType rasPt[3];
00540 
00541       rasPts->Reset();
00542       for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00543       {
00544           screenPt = polygon->GetPoint(i);
00545           this->SetReformatPoint(as, (int)(screenPt[0]), (int)(screenPt[1]));
00546           this->GetWldPoint(rasPt);
00547           rasPts->InsertNextPoint((vtkFloatingPointType)(rasPt[0]),
00548                                   (vtkFloatingPointType)(rasPt[1]),
00549                                   (vtkFloatingPointType)(rasPt[2]));
00550       }
00551       switch (window)
00552       {
00553           case 0: AxiRasPolyStack->SetPolygon(rasPts, s, p, d, closed, preshape, label);
00554                   break;
00555           case 1: SagRasPolyStack->SetPolygon(rasPts, s, p, d, closed, preshape, label);
00556                   break;
00557           case 2: CorRasPolyStack->SetPolygon(rasPts, s, p, d, closed, preshape, label);
00558                   break;
00559       }
00560       return this->rasPts;
00561   };
00562 
00563   void StackRemovePolygon(int window, int s, int p)
00564   {
00565       switch (window)
00566       {
00567           case 0: this->AxiPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00568                   break;
00569           case 1: this->SagPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00570                   break;
00571           case 2: this->CorPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00572                   break;
00573       }
00574   };
